paragraphs.1: Decides to proclaim 16 September as International Day for Interventional Cardiology;
paragraphs.2: Invites all Member States, organizations of the United Nations system and other global, regional and subregional organizations, as well as other relevant stakeholders, including civil society, non-governmental organizations, the private sector, academia and individuals, to observe annually the International Day for Interventional Cardiology in an appropriate manner and in accordance with national priorities, in order to raise public awareness of cardiovascular diseases and procedures, related complications, as well as prevention and care, including through education and the mass media;
paragraphs.3: Invites the World Health Organization to facilitate the implementation of the International Day;
paragraphs.4: Stresses that the costs of all activities that may arise from the implementation of the present resolution should be met through voluntary contributions, including from the private sector;
paragraphs.5: Requests the Secretary-General to bring the present resolution to the attention of all Member States, the organizations of the United Nations system and other relevant stakeholders, including civil society, the private sector and academia, for appropriate observance.
